name: Newcastle United FC History Online Quiz | Newcastle United | 10 Questions

questions.text: In which year was the club formed?
questions.explanation:
1881.

	Newcastle United were formed in 1881, and turned professional in 1889.

questions.text: Where did the club first play their home games?
questions.explanation:
South Byker.

	Newcastle played at South Byker between 1881-86, followed by Chillingham Road until 1892, when they moved into St. James Park.

questions.text: Who was the club's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
Frank Watt.

	Watt was manager between 1895-1930, followed by Cunningham (1930-35), Mather (1935-39), and Seymour was in the hot seat between 1939-47. Over the years, Newcastle have had some famous names as managers, including Ossie Ardiles, Kevin Keegan, Kenny Dalglish and Sir Bobby Robson.

questions.text: Which of these is NOT a nickname given to the club?
questions.explanation:
Black & Whites.

	The nickname 'The Magpies' is because they play in black and white. The word 'Toon' comes from the Newcastle accent for the pronunciation of 'Town'.

questions.text: How many times in the 20th century did Newcastle win the League title?
questions.explanation:
4.

	Season 1904-05 saw the title come to Newcastle for the first time. They won it three more seasons in the 20th century after that, in 1906-07, 1908-09 and 1926-27.

questions.text: Which of these players scored the most League goals for Newcastle?
questions.explanation:
Jackie Milburn.

	'Wor Jackie' Milburn scored 178 League goals for the club between 1946-57.

questions.text: When was the last time in the 20th century that Newcastle won the FA Cup?
questions.explanation:
1955.

	Newcastle first won the cup in 1910 with a 2-0 win over Barnsley. Then again in 1924 when they beat Aston Villa 2-0. 1932 was the next FA Cup with a 2-1 defeat of Arsenal. Three more cups in the 1950s followed, with Blackpool losing 2-0 in 1951, Arsenal 1-0 in 1952, and Manchester City 3-1 in 1955 (their 6th FA Cup win).

questions.text: Who did Newcastle beat 13-0 in 1946, to set a record for their biggest League victory?
questions.explanation:
Newport County.

	The game took place on 5th October 1946, in a Division Two match.

questions.text: Which of these played the most League games for Newcastle?
questions.explanation:
Jimmy Lawrence.

	Lawrence played 432 games for the club between 1904-22.

questions.text: Did Newcastle play in the inaugural FA Premiership season 1992-93?
questions.explanation:
No.

	They played in Division One that season, but finished as champions and played in the Premiership the following season, in 1993-94 where they went on to finish an impressive 3rd, 7 points behind second placed Blackburn Rovers, and 15 behind champions Manchester United.
